greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the prime indices of n minus the greater of the number of prime factors of n counted with multiplicity and the largest prime index of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n.

Also the number of squares in the Young diagram of the integer partition with Heinz number n after the first row or the first column, whichever is larger, is removed. The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
link: FindStat, St000784: The maximum of the length and the largest part of the integer partition
example: 88 has 4 prime indices {1,1,1,5} with sum 8 and maximum 5, so a(88) = 8 - max(4,5) = 3.
xref: Positions of 0's are A174090. Positions of 1's are A325231.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 12 2019
